page.title: 06NEW ABBEY - HEALTH
page.content: This is a healthy place to live and few die from infectious diseases.No mothers die in childbirth as all are confined in a modern maternity unit in Dumfries. Our children are healthy,but the young are at risk from accidents e.g.road traffic, (especially motor cycles) farm machinery,power saws,etc. There is a high incidence of raised blood pressure,leading to strokes and heart attacks.Smoking, overeating, and alcohol are blamed.Many of the elderly die of cancer,and treatment has little effect. Due to contraception,families are smaller and fewer young people work on farms.Retired people from the cities settle here,so there are more elderly. This is a problem for the welfare and medical services,with an increasing shortage of suitable accommodation when they become confused and infirm.
